meanings.definition: The branch of chemistry concerned with the three-dimensional arrangement of atoms in molecules and the effect of this arrangement on chemical reactions.
meanings.sent1: Understanding stereochemistry helps chemists predict how molecules will react.
meanings.sent2: In organic chemistry, stereochemistry plays a crucial role in determining the outcome of reactions.
meanings.sent3: The students found stereochemistry fascinating as it was like solving a 3D puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Stereochemistry is the architectural blueprint that guides chemical transformations.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing stereochemistry is like seeing a molecular dance in action.

meanings.definition: The study of the spatial arrangement of atoms within a molecule and the effect of this arrangement on the molecule's properties.
meanings.sent1: Stereochemistry explores how the arrangement of atoms influences a molecule's behavior.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use stereochemistry to understand how structure impacts function in molecules.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that stereochemistry was like playing a game of molecular Tetris.
meanings.sent4: In the world of molecules, stereochemistry is the master conductor of properties.
meanings.sent5: Studying stereochemistry is like deciphering the language of molecular architecture.
